Posts.Content: I use Biotene oral gel for dry mouth worked well . GP prescribed it ... I also use Caphosol for the pain again GP prescribed.  Both of these had been recommended to me by long standing cancer survivors ... Tried and tested both of them .  Good luck Liz
Posts.Title: Docetaxal and dry throat/mouth

Posts.Content: Morning Yvonne I was just wondering how you are this morning and hoping you are feeling less stressed and ready to deal with whatever today may bring .... Sending you positive vibes and hope you have planned something nice to distract you from worrying about this blasted visitor you have ..... LOL regards Liz
Posts.Title: This time I think i'am going fall apart

Posts.Content: Ahh Pat .... You hit the spot in so many ways ......that is such an understanding and supporting message for Yvonne .... Just had to let you know.  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: This time I think i'am going fall apart

Posts.Content: Hello lilianc.  This is so awful .... I have never heard of the condition . Do the docs have any posive news like how long it will last and what treatment will help. Sorry I have no advice for you but hope it gets better quickly and you don't get a reoccurance. regards Liz
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi  there is a lot of  info on diet which can be very overwhelming . The best advice I have had  is to maintain a healthy weight and do some light/ moderate exercise for 30 mins every day. I joined a.Trial when I started my chemo looking at weight gain in ladies on chemo. I was randomly selected to follow a Mediterranean diet which I have done. I have managed to loose some weight whilst on chemo and most days managed to either walk or go to the gym. I will definitely carry on following the diet now I have finished chemo and hopefully continue to drop a few more pounds when my energy levels improve . I was at the top end of a healthy weight when I started the chemo and have maintained a healthy appetite throughout . I can't say I have felt deprived of anything and I still enjoy "wine o'clock " on a regular basis. One of the challenges whilst on treatment is to keep active which can be very difficult when you have mega side effects . I was also advised not to eat certain foods throughout treatment like prawns/ raw fish runny eggs ,unpasteurised cheese , bio yogurts and certain cheese . Looking forward to my first soft egg and soldiers for breakfast very soon just giving myself 6 weeks from last chemo yummy. Hope some of this helps. regards Liz
Posts.Title: I am reading lots of info re diet and did not realise a change was...

Posts.Content: A very BIG thank you Emma .woke up this morning to read your INSPIRATIONAL story.....   Everyone needs an "Alfie" I think.  Keep well Emma  and a Big hug to Alfie rega.rds Liz
Posts.Title: Pedal to the metal!

Posts.Content: hi everyone had my first mammogram today since diagnosis and got the thumbs up / nothing to worry about. What a relief that was so celebrated with a bottle of wine tonight ..... Whooooo... Crufts tomorrow so need to be up bright and early. Enjoy your weekend everyone. Regards Liz
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: Hi Mistymoley we could have said Hello if I had known you were there. Where you showing or visiting ? It was my first time and yes it was bedlam.... Will definately be going again ..... Regards Liz
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: What a beautiful breed so elegant didn't one pick up a first in the hounds section??? I didn't buy any clothes but did buy Herbie (I 'm grandma to my daughters Newfie) a couple of things. I saw breeds I never heard of ...... just a brilliant show.  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: Thanks everyone for the good wishes .... Had a brilliant day at Crufts albeit a tiring one.... Well done Nannymary on your weight loss that is a great achievement ... And over Xmas as well ...  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: One year on........

Posts.Content: Thanks Mena for the explanation ...... Glad something so simple worked a treat . Can u tell me what Muga is now .... ??? Cherry B that is a flash from the past .... Have you tried/ remember Pony and Babycham for a bit of  sparkle.... Enjoy the weekend  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Wow Mena what is the arm warming sink??? We had a type of bean bag popped in the microwave . Good luck regards Liz
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Good morning Aliand thanks.......something new to learn every day.meeting up with my gym Buddy later got nothing exciting planned til tomorrow . Going to Chester for an over night girlie get together with my lovely sisters. Got the champagne ready strawberries and dipping chocolate for a celebration . We are going to take off my very short grey and fuzzy hair ....... Ughhhh will need the fizz for the Dutch courage.... Have a good weekend and I do hope you are not suffering to much from your last chemo.....LOL.  Liz
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: FREEDOM THURSDAYS/ FIZZ FRIDAY good morning to all you lovely ladies just wanted to say I am sooooooooo excited for you all who are on your final drug run...... Yippee ...... No more Hostage Thursdays/Fridays .... Thinking of you all . LOL  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Hi everyone  just woke up and straight onto the forum.... The thoughts of finishing this nightmare and going straight into the next really upsets me. I am writing this with tears streaming down my face. I had my first battle with BC nine years ago and getting on with my life after that didn't seem to bad. This time the cancer went to lymph nodes not plain sailing . I have 6 sessions of chemo to go and having problems withe the drugs
Posts.Title: Finding the uncertainty unbearable at times

Posts.Content: Oh Yvonne well done you keeping so positive when obviously things need to be checked . I am so glad your BCN was lovely just what you needed. I am sure she said contact her if you need anything and that includes reassurance if you falter . Looks like you will be on that horrible waiting roller coaster . It's so worrying for all your family and they all cope differently or not .... Keep strong and use your BCN she is a neutral support ....xxx regards Liz
Posts.Title: Seen my BCN today ??

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne  it's difficult one I went 9 years in between the Bugggggaaaar returning. ..........it's hard to trust your body when you have had one scare.... I'm afraid it's the waiting game until after your tests.... Someone on this forum wrote recently worrying is a waste of your time and we don't want to do that do we. Instead of counting the days make every day count ..... You can do it your a bit of an expert don't you know. LOL  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: Seen my BCN today ??

Posts.Content: Hi Shaz well done 1 down and laughing that's great . Prickly bum my Ass ...... Heeeeeeeeeee. Clearly those chemo nurses have never really experienced it first hand ( thank goodness) you wouldn't wish it on your worst enemy..... It is such a weird sensation thank goodness it doesn't last long ...  Have a good weekend chill out and listen to your body ... Regards Liz x
Posts.Title: prickly bum

Posts.Content: Hello Stocko    Hope your chat helped to ease your worries.... Honestly you can do this ..... Hopefully you will not have to many side effects .... If you need any info this is the place so if nothing else helps knowing we are here 24/7 (well some of us ) may ease the journey. thinking of you tomorrow Regards Liz
Posts.Title: going for my chemo chat today

Posts.Content: Hi Blue Roan  thanks for sharing this info . I had a severe attack of peripheral neuropathy on the hands , bottom and legs . No one mentioned this side effect to me so I was totally taken by surprise  4 weeks in on the Paclitaxel . I was eventually prescribed Pregablin which worked immediately. I was told by one of the chemo nurses the 9 taxol would be a walk in the park compared to the Fec but not for me. My bloods got so low treatment was delayed by two weeks and then reduced by 20%. I am now 5 weels post chemo and dealing with labrynthitis . I have weaned myself off Pregablin and on Letrozole and Risedronate. My energy levels and pains are worse than on the chemo I have not been able to exercise this week due to the dizziness and fatigue . I will take a look at your blog wished I had known about the complimenta.rybtherapies before I started my regime. I have been following a meditatranean diet throughout chemo and found this really good and even managed to loose a few pounds to boot. regards Liz
Posts.Title: Taxol & Peripheral Neuropathy - check this out!

Posts.Content: Hello Yvonne great news about your appointment. Expect you will see a consultant  for an examination and depending on the outcome you may have any/ all of the above....... No worrying inadvance now you can't change anything  ..... Easier said than done I know you need to do something to distract your thoughts away from it til Tuesday.... have a lovely weekend  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: I've got my appointment

Posts.Content: Today I read that the Oncytype dx test as been approved by NHS to be used for certain cancers . Anyone else read this really good news . Not sure how quickly it will roll out and be offered to those who it would benefit. I had the test last year via a trial I took part in for me I wasn't low risk so ended up having chemo this test will save alt of people having chemo with little benefit.  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: Anastrasole/Arimidex Questions (for invasive lobular breast cancer...

Posts.Content: Ahhhh that is so nice ..... Similar happened for me last Sat .... It cheers you up no end.... Enjoy and hope tomorrow is a better day. regards Liz
Posts.Title: Just had a nice surprise

Posts.Content: Hi everyone my hair is showing signs of growth very slowly . It is Snow White .....  It was recommended that I shave it all off again when it gets to about quarter of an inch or so to allow for a more even re growth. It will be hard to do but am willing to do it if it works ..... Anyone else had the same advice please????  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Hi Katie thanks for your reply I was beginning to think it was only me that had heard this. It is so painful watching it grow at a snails pace. If it was warmer I wouldn't bother now about going without scarf or wig... I don't want to go on holiday with a wig so have very mixed feelings ..... Uggggghhhhh......I will try the Redken product as mentioned in another post. Anything that will stimulate growth is worth a try. good news about the drain coming out .... Take care regards liz
Posts.Title: scalp

Posts.Content: Good morning     shortperson AKA (Grumpy bum ) kids don't you just love them ..... They tell you how it is ... i think you should change your name now . Look on the bright side at least your little love didn't call you 'prickly bum' which he may have overheard a conversation about .... ...  seriously though it must be awful trying to be a mum to little ones and deal with the side effects of this ::::::::::::( the words I am thinking are unprintable for all you lovely ladies & gents). I have wrote on here before how much i admire you Mums you really are the best ever Mums regardless of how grumpy you may get... So give yourself a GREAT BIG well done me .... and take each day as it comes .... Lots of cyber energy for you and your family.  LO Energy Hugs Lizx
Posts.Title: grumpy bum

Posts.Content: Hello   I am 5 weeks post chemo and my hair is sprouting . Very fine and patchy and grey/ white. My chemo nurse recommended I shave it all off again when it starts to grow. She said this is because the toxins are still in our bodies and effects the hair growthBy shaving it off the next re growth will be more even and less chemically affected. Have nothing to offer re facial hair sorry my concern is how long shall I let it grow before shaving it again. regards Liz
Posts.Title: Hair - again

Posts.Content: Hi  I had one injection 24 hrs following each Fec (3) and had no problems . My bloods went haywire on the Paclitaxel and had two weeks delay before and during Christmas...  You should ask the question if you don't you will always be wondering what if.....  Good luck keep us posted... regards Liz
Posts.Title: G scf ,help

Posts.Content: Oh weary mum you are making very difficult decisions I wish you and your girls the best positive outcome .... It is such a nightmare which you have and still are living with ...... Life is so unjust for so many lovely people...  Kind regards to you and yours  Liz
Posts.Title: New Clinical Trial

Posts.Content: Hi Apple I used Audi books when going to sleep .... I got an Audi pillow from Aldi as a present and that was much better than headphones so comfy and no complaints from other half about noise seepage. The only thing was it took me ages to get through a book as I kept falling asleep and missed whole chunks of the story. Still got my monies worth and some rest as well. I found going out for short periods helped coffee or shops took my mind off things. I know what you mean about not being able to concentrate I was the same TV or films had no interest. Quite liked plYing games on my phone though they got quite addictive.  Good luck  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: anxiety between mastectomy and lymph results

Posts.Content: Good morning everyone Ifound Biotene oral gel really helpful for the dry mouth . They do a mouth wash and toothpaste . I haven't tried the latter two. I also found Difflam mouthwash very good . Both of these my Doc prescribed also Difflam spray is really good as you can get it down your throat . The really good stuff is Caphosol you can use this several times a day but it does dry out the mouth so you will need the Biotene to replace the moisture. regards Liz
Posts.Title: Aches & pains - part 2

Posts.Content: Hello Mrs D. I was prescribed Caphosol which worked a treat unlike the Difflam which they recommend three times a day you could use this much more. The thing is it did dry my mouth out so had to use Biotene gel . You can get Biotene mouthwash and toothpaste I never used either but suspect it would be okay if the gel is anything to go by. I brushed with a small soft head toothbrush three times a day at least. I also had the nystatin oral drops for oral thrush which worked well Good luck with it  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: sore mouth.

Posts.Content: Great result well done Sarah and well done Mum for having done such a good job .... You are so right to be proud and thanks for raising so much for us all . regards Liz
Posts.Title: VERY PROUD OF MY DAUGHTER

Posts.Content: Good morning Anne  i am sure you are right . I look in the mirror and feel like I've aged by 10 yrs..... Having no hair and big ears isn't helping my look. I am using also rats of creams and potions to no avail. I am hoping when the treatment finishes things will improve I would hold off on the plastic surgery for awhile. You could try a course of non surgical face lifts if you can get anyone to touch you whilst having treatment. My vision as been affected as well along with my bladder control . I wish you well don't do anything hasty you will need all your energies to complete the chemo. Keep us posted . regards Liz
Posts.Title: What chemo does to facial skin

Posts.Content: Hi I have 2 more  treatments to go and for 4 weeks now my nails have been deteriorating . They were hurting for a couple of weeks before they turned brown. They are firmly attached but began to peel at the tips thin layers where they were brown. They look a terrible mess and I really don't know what I can do but be patient and keep massaging my cuticles. Good luck everyone all your tips are are greatly appreciated. Liz
Posts.Title: Weird nails

Posts.Content: Morning butterfly    You could be suffering from fatigue .... I have read that some bone pain can be caused around the treated area but should improve with time.... But if it is all over  then you need to get it checked out . I have aches in my joints but they ease off once I get moving. I am sure someone will answer with better info soon . Take care.  Liz
Posts.Title: body aches

Posts.Content: Hi Katie Pre last BC diagnosis I took glucosamine daily for joint pains .... Stopped all tabs through treatment but now back on Omega 3 and glucosamine.... Jury unclear on its benefits but I am going to continue .... On Letrozole and Risedronate plus Calceo... Good luck hope you keep well. Regards Liz
Posts.Title: Glucosamine?

Posts.Content: Hello Irish Girl  you have every right to be scared . You are doing really good managing all those side effects. The positive is they have not stopped treatment they must have been giving you the biggest dose they could hence your side effects... Sarah is right the treatments are improving at a rapid rate . Are you takinG part in any trials ?you could ask if there are any ground breaking treatments you could be involved in when you are feeling less poorly.. As the tumour shrank during all of this take strength in your plan and don't suffer in silence keep asking and keep posting . Sometimes stats are not helpful its best to focus on you and what is best for you ..... I will keep looking for your posts and send you positive kick ass cancer thoughts ....  Liz
Posts.Title: Very scared

Posts.Content: Good morning Alison 65 r u a Lancashire lass to or is the Lancashire your surname ???? Just being a Nosey Northerner.  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: Mastectomy on Monday and really scared!

Posts.Content: Hi everyone Just had my line fitted ... No sedative which meant I could drive myself home. Feel ok the whole proceedure was no worse than 6 attempts to get blood from my Chemo wrecked veins. I had blds taken didn't even know it had happened . Hoping round 5 of PAC 20% reduced dose doesn't make the nerve damage any worse. Thank you all for your support and info very helpful . Happy New Year to u all. Regards McKay Fraser
Posts.Title: Hickman Line

Posts.Content: Mine to Bev can't believe I have reached the end ..... I have Letrozole and Alendronic for the next 5 years to contend with ... I have had rads so don't have to worry about that. For all you waiting to have rads its a walk in the park compared to Chemo . The travelling every day is probably most tiring. Follow the instructions on moisturising and bathing routine and you will be fine.  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: last chemo friday

Posts.Content: Hi everyone I live in Cheshire and I am on the list for the next course which starts in September and runs for 6 weeks ... Seems like most places are running them . My phiso was saying last week that they are part of the holistic approach to supporting people after treatment finnishes as having the treatment is really only a small part of having a cancer diagnosis...  Regards Liz

Posts.Content: Love this pic made me laugh. Thanks x
Posts.Title: A few tips from my Cancer Survivorship Course

Posts.Content: Hi Katee   I have very similar issues ... I have my first appointment with physio tomorrow . The lymphodeema nurse referred me have been waiting a few weeks . I'm hoping she will work on the muscle and tendons which have gone very tight under the armpit. I also have swelling in the Breast and upper arm as well as in my back . I also have scarring under the Breast which goes rock hard depending on the swelling and usage. I will let you know how I get on. regards Liz
Posts.Title: Tight arm feeling

Posts.Content: good morning everyone.  Been awhile since I posted anything and I can see there are some ladies and gents still posting from last year. I am now taking Anastrozole as I had serious side affects with Letrozole. I began suffering with anxiety and breathlessness and became what I can only describe as mistrusting of people. I am now feeling a significant amount of joint pain in my fingers and wrists and was wondering if anyone else as had similar problems. enjoy your day folks sun shinning here in Cheshire
Posts.Title: Anastrozole joint pain

Posts.Content: Hi R this is a new one ..... Sounds horrible.... I was given nystatin oral drops for thrush so would defo ring the helpline / onc for advice....  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: tongue

Posts.Content: Hi Scribblinglady Mistymoley is right you should get it checked you maybe still be bleeding . I say this because my aunty 83 had blood taken recently and the nurse struggled to get a vein. Anyhow she continued to bleed from the first attempt and ended up with an arm twice the size and black& blue down to her finger tips. Hope it's not of course but please get it checked.  Regards Liz
Posts.Title: new bruising one week on

Posts.Content: Out of the mouths of babes ..... So uplifting . Thanks Pat Regards Liz

Posts.Content: Out of the mouths of babes ..... So uplifting . Thanks Pat Regards Liz
Posts.Title: A smile to start today.

Posts.Content: Good morning Alicemay     The same thing happened to me a year ago BUT you know what whatever it is it's been picked up and that's all for the best ..... Fingers crossed for good news  lOLuck Liz x
Posts.Title: Mammogram

Posts.Content: Morning Aliowl  if it's not one thing it's another .... I forgot about  my nails hurting ...... Pretty much par for the course I'm afraid . Sounds like Dreamthief is right about the P. N . I had it just before Xmas and was put on Pregablin and had my tax reduced. you need to mention it to GP especially if it is interfering with your recovery. Glad to hear you are feeling a bit better.  Cheers Liz
Posts.Title: weird question? ??

Posts.Content: Thanks Carla for letting us know of this important day ... It had slipped under my radar completely or I would have been flying the flag and celebrating the role of  women in the world . Congratulations to one and all especially all ladies on this site and beyond for their tenacity  and their will to survive even though the odds are against them.. Go Girls / Ladies xxxxxx regards Liz
Posts.Title: It's International Women's Day !!

Posts.Content: hi everyone thought I would share this with all you ladies who have posted re hair loss. Had a girlie over nighter with my two sisters at weekend to celebrate 7 weeks post chemo. We shopped and dined til we dropped then we shaved my half inch of baby fluff off which had grown in the hope this next regrowth will be stronger. I will keep you posted on this ..... We celebrated the de fluffing with Champagne and strawberries dipped in Ameretto Choclate so took the edge off Being completely bald again ...... Have a good day everyone I'm off to the gym then physio on the underarm scarring.... Never a dull moment .....  Cheers Liz
Posts.Title: Hair Loss 2

Posts.Content: Hi Ali is your mouth sore you MUST drink my lovely try one of George's drips .... I liked the G&T version he recommended at Xmas ...... If that fails get some ice lollies .... I 'm not a big water fan ..... I've seen those boats on the canal with Rusty bottoms ...... Haaaaa........  LOL Liz x
Posts.Title: weird question? ??

Posts.Content: Morning Spenfold i am full of admiration doing your own injections ...... I had the  DN come in the nxt day to do mine only had them whilst on Fec . good luck don,t think of it as failure more Bad Luck must have been a faulty one .....  Regards Liz
